main.name: Jessica Bradham
main.description: Software Developer with a background in digital media design. As a technical designer and professor of digital media design I bring a uniquely detailed and experienced perspective to every project.
main.bio: Software Developer with a background in digital media design. As a technical designer and professor of digital media design I bring a uniquely detailed and experienced perspective to every project.
main.contactmessage: Here is where you should write your message to readers to have them get in contact with you.

resume.skillmessage: Skilled in Ruby, Rails, SQL, Javascript (ES6), React, Redux, Postgres, HTML, CSS, Sass, CreateJS, Sinatra, ActiveRecord, Photoshop, Illustrator, Adobe Animate, After Effects, Audacity, Audition, Premiere, Final Cut Pro, Github, SVN, and Heroku

education.degree: Full Stack Web Development, Ruby on Rails and JavaScript program

education.school: Kendall College of Art and Design of Ferris State University

work.title: Technical Media Production Specialist & Designer
work.description: I was hired to assist in fixing a very long list of graphic, video, and audio bugs. Due to my efficiancy and technical knowledge I was able to clear the list entirely, and expand the role to other tasks. Expanded responsibilities included building ebooks in xhtml, building muiltmedia and interactive ebooks in xhtml, javascript, and json, prototyping webpages using the bootstrap framework, building small web games for the homepage, and prototyping apps.

work.title: Web Development Intern
work.description: Set up web pages based on wireframes and flat designs using Wordpress and content building plugins.

work.company: Kendall College of Art and Design
work.title: Adjunct Professor
work.description: Created curriculums for and taught classes in design and interation, my interaction design class focused on teaching students to design and build their first interactive project using html5 canvas with Javascript.

work.title: Lead Artist & Flash Programmer
work.description: Lead a team of remote artists for a web game, orangized content, created plotlines, drew illustrations, and programmed web games.

work.company: Kendall College of Art and Design
work.title: Student Employement - Kendall Weblab
work.description: Worked as a student making modifications to the schoolâ€™s student showcase website making minor changes to the layout, and updating content.

work.title: Designer & Developer
work.description: Programmed and illustrated original web games.

projects.title: Air & Space Museum
projects.category: (Currently frontend only) A public museum webpage that allows the public to get tickets for the museum attractions, and learn more about the museum.
projects.technology3: Javascript Parallax Animated Background with 5 Depth Layers
projects.technology4: Accelerometer Driven Animated Background on Android Devices
projects.technology5: Polymorphic Association for Tickets to associate with different models

projects.title: Pokemon Simulator
projects.category: A social media style game with the ability to  earn virtual currency, buy items, collect pokemon, create pokemon teams, chat on a forum, add friends, and play a game.
projects.technology4: Whack-A-Mole Game created with CreateJS Library/Javascript, Mobile Friendly
projects.technology5: Utilizes PokeAPI for capturing pokemon, and buying items

projects.title: MediGrowth
projects.category: Log in as a user with Username: 'patient' Password 'test'. Log in as a Physician with Username 'doctor' Password 'test'. A web application developed to help people track symptoms and medical conditions, and share their journals with physicians. Built using Ruby, Sinatra, Activerecord, Chartkick, Sinatra Flash, and Sass.
projects.technology2: Fully Responsive Frontend with pure CSS and Vanilla Javascript
projects.technology3: Protected Views to protect patient privacy
projects.technology4: Incorporated Chartkick (Chartjs library) to allow users and doctors to visualize data entered over time

projects.title: Wheel of Fortune: CLI App
projects.category: A Wheel of Fortune themed game I built to run in the commandline, plays like a one play version of Wheel of Fortune.
projects.technology1: Built in pure Ruby to run in the Command Line
projects.technology2: Utilizes Imagemagick, Catpix, and Rmagick to print images in the commandline
projects.technology3: Incorporates the QuoteGarden to pull thousands of quotes as puzzles for the game.

projects.title: Pizza Savant
projects.category: A responsive website I designed and built for a Pizza Restaurant, complete with a javascript menu, scroll animations, and the Google Maps API embedded.
